step_by_step.description: Bepaal onbelaste spanning U₀ met superpositie
step_by_step.details: Method 1 (Intuitive): Set -/- as Ground = 0V. Voltage difference between 12+ and 3+ is 9V. Voltage divider of 9Ω total gives 1V/Ω. From 12+ perspective: 12 - 6 = 6V. From 3+ perspective: 3 + 3 = 6V.

sub_exercises.title: Network with Cascaded Voltage Sources and Resistors
sub_exercises.circuit_description: Network with voltage source 4V, resistor 10Ω in series, and another branch with 6V source and 18Ω resistor
sub_exercises.question_text: Vereenvoudig dit netwerk tot Thévenin en Norton equivalenten

solution.key_insight: From the output, the 4V source with R=0 is visible from the output terminals. The left branch (6V, 18Ω) behind it is not relevant.

step_by_step.calculation: Rth = 10Ω (Only the visible series resistor from output perspective)

step_by_step.details: First: Effect of 6V with 4V shorted: U₆V = 0V (blocked by the 4V source with R=0)

step_by_step.note: The 18Ω resistor will have -2V across it, meaning the current flows into the 6V source (supplying power)

sub_exercises.title: Network with Voltage Source and Current Source
sub_exercises.circuit_description: Network with 12V source, 20Ω resistor, and 2A current source (oriented downward - 'wrong way')
sub_exercises.question_text: Vereenvoudig dit netwerk tot Thévenin en Norton equivalenten

solution.key_insight: Current source flows 'the wrong way' (downward), creating negative voltage

step_by_step.calculation: Rth = 20Ω || ∞ = 20Ω (Current source has infinite internal resistance)

step_by_step.details: Effect of 12V with current source open
step_by_step.calculation: U₁₂V = 0V (No current flows, no voltage drop)

step_by_step.details: Effect of 2A current source with 12V shorted
step_by_step.calculation: U₂A = -2A × 20Ω = -40V (Current flows opposite, creating negative voltage)

method_1_intuitive.note: Convert 2A current source to equivalent voltage source: 2A × 10Ω = 20V
method_1_intuitive.calculation_voltage_divider: Voltage divider with difference of (20-5)V = 15V across 2×10Ω. Each resistor gets 7.5V

step_2.description: Node equation for right top node

step_4.verification: Or from right side: Uth = I₂ × 10Ω = 1.25A × 10Ω = 12.5V ✓

part_a.description: Effect of 5V with current source open

thevenin_equivalent.definition: A network simplified to a single voltage source (Uth) in series with an internal resistance (Rth)
calculation_steps: 1. Open the load at the output terminals
2. Calculate Uth: open circuit voltage across the terminals
3. Calculate Ri: either by finding equivalent resistance with sources deactivated, or use Ri = Uth / Ik
4. Calculate Ik: short circuit current when terminals are shorted

norton_equivalent.definition: A network simplified to a single current source (In) in parallel with an internal resistance (Rn)
norton_equivalent.relationship_to_thevenin: In = Uth / Rth, and Rn = Rth

key_concepts.superposition_method: When multiple independent sources (voltage or current) are present, calculate the effect of each source independently, then add the results
